<static> timeOutAfter

Properties:
Name Type Argument Default Description
timeOutAfter number <optional>
 PFT.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT the default max amount of time allowed for tests to run before they are marked as a fail. this can be overridden for a specific test by passing a 'maxDuration' option to the PFT.tester.test function

Methods

<static> done()

function to be called at the end of asynchronous test, setup and tearDown. This indicates that the next scheduled item can be executed. Only call this function when all tasks are complete within a PFT.tester.test

<static> start()

function that will start the execution of all tests added through the PFT.tester.test function. Calling this method while already running has no side effects

<static> stop()

function will halt the triggering of any additional tests following completion of the existing task

  • pft.js, line 1149

<static> suite()

function will set the suite of any subsequent tests to this suite name
Source:
  • pft.js, line 907

<static> test(name, options, data, callback)

function will schedule the passed in testCallback for execution. When the test is complete it MUST call PFT.tester.done to indicate that the next step should proceed
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
name string the name of the test
options Object <optional>
 {} a set of options specific to this test
Properties
Name Type Argument Description
maxDuration Integer <optional>
 the maximum amount of time this test will be allowed to execute in milliseconds
setup function <optional>
 a function to be called prior to execution of this test. When complete a setup function MUST call PFT.tester.done to indicate that the setup is complete
tearDown Integer <optional>
 a function to be called after execution of this test. When complete a tearDown function MUST call PFT.tester.done to indicate that the tearDown is complete
data Object <optional>
 undefined an Object to be passed to the test upon execution. This can be used for parameterization of tests.
callback testCallback the function to execute as a test. when executed this function will be passed three arguments, a PhantomJs.Webpage.Page, a data object and a reference to the PFT.tester.assert object
Source:
  • pft.js, line 936
